sen.j: 七代目 中村 芝翫（しちだいめ なかむら しかん、1928年（昭和3年）3月11日 -）は、歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: The seventh Shikan NAKAMURA (March 11, 1928 -) is a Kabuki actor.
The seventh Shikan NAKAMURA (March 11, 1928 -) is a Kabuki actor.
The seventh Shikan NAKAMURA (March 11, 1928 -) is a Kabuki actor.

sen.j: 本名は中村 榮次郎（なかむら えいじろう）。
sen.e: His real name is Eijiro NAKAMURA.
His real name is Eijiro NAKAMURA.
His real name is Eijiro NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 旧名は中村 眞喜雄（なかむら まきお）。
sen.e: His previous name was Makio NAKAMURA.
His previous name was Makio NAKAMURA.
His previous name was Makio NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 俳名は梅莟、屋号は成駒屋、定紋は祇園守、替紋は裏梅。
sen.e: His Haimyo (nickname) is Baigan, his family's theatrical name is Narikoma-ya, his Jomon (family crest) is gionmori (the emblem of the family), and his Kaemon (alternate personal crest) is ura-ume (reversed plum flower).
sen.cmt: 梅莟 = 読み方不明 祇園守の意味するもの（紋であるという以上の）が分かりませんでした。
sen.e: His Haimyo (nickname) is Baigan, his family's theatrical name is Narikoma-ya, his Jomon (family crest) is gionmori (the emblem of the family), and his Kaemon (alternate personal crest) is ura-ume (reversed plum flower).

His Haimyo (nickname) is Baigan, his family's theatrical name is Narikoma-ya, his Jomon (family crest) is gionmori (the emblem of the family), and his Kaemon (alternate personal crest) is ura-ume (reversed plum flower).

sen.j: 紫綬褒章受章、日本芸術院会員、重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）。
sen.e: He was honored with a shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon), he is a member of The Japan Art Academy, and a holder of the title of 'Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure)'.

He was honored with a shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon), he is a member of The Japan Art Academy, and a holder of the title of 'Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure)'.

He was honored with a shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon), he is a member of The Japan Art Academy, and a holder of the title of 'Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure)'.

sen.j: 2008年日本俳優協会会長。
sen.e: Since 2008 he has served as Chairman of the Japan Actors' Association.
Since 2008 he has served as Chairman of the Japan Actors' Association.
Since 2008 he has served as Chairman of the Japan Actors' Association.

sen.j: 早生した中村福助 (5代目)の子。
sen.e: He is a son of Fukusuke NAKAMURA V, who died young.
sen.cmt: 早生→早世の誤りと考えて訳出しました。
sen.e: He is a son of Fukusuke NAKAMURA V, who died young.
He is a son of Fukusuke NAKAMURA V, who died young.

sen.j: 父の死後、祖父中村歌右衛門 (5代目)の身内となり、四代目中村児太郎の名で1933年（昭和8年）11月歌舞伎座『桐一葉』に初舞台を踏む。
sen.e: After his father's death he became a protégé of his grandfather, Utaemon NAKAMURA V, and debuted as Kotaro NAKAMURA IV in "Kiri Hitoha" (a single paulownia leaf) in Kabuki-za Theater in November 1933.

After his father's death he became a protégé of his grandfather, Utaemon NAKAMURA V, and debuted as Kotaro NAKAMURA IV in "Kiri Hitoha" (a single paulownia leaf) in Kabuki-za Theater in November 1933.

After his father's death he became a protégé of his grandfather, Utaemon NAKAMURA V, and debuted as Kotaro NAKAMURA IV in "Kiri Hitoha" (a single paulownia leaf) in Kabuki-za Theater in November 1933.

sen.j: 祖父の死後は、尾上菊五郎 (6代目)に師事、1941年（昭和16年）10月歌舞伎座で『戻駕』『仮名手本忠臣蔵・九段目』で七代目中村福助を襲名。
sen.e: After his grandfather's death he studied under Kikugoro ONOE VI and adopted the name of Fukusuke NAKAMURA (VII) for performances of "Modorikago (A Returning Palanquin)" and "Kudanme (9th act) of Kanadehon Chushingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers)" in Kabuki-za Theater in October 1941.

After his grandfather's death he studied under Kikugoro ONOE VI and adopted the name of Fukusuke NAKAMURA (VII) for performances of "Modorikago (A Returning Palanquin)" and "Kudanme (9th act) of Kanadehon Chushingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers)" in Kabuki-za Theater in October 1941.

After his grandfather's death he studied under Kikugoro ONOE VI and adopted the name of Fukusuke NAKAMURA (VII) for performances of "Modorikago (A Returning Palanquin)" and "Kudanme (9th act) of Kanadehon Chushingura (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers)" in Kabuki-za Theater in October 1941.

sen.j: 戦後は、中堅の女形として活躍。
sen.e: He put on great performances as a mid-level female impersonator after the war.
He put on great performances as a mid-level female impersonator after the war.
He put on great performances as a mid-level female impersonator after the war.

sen.j: 1959年（昭和34年）毎日演劇賞・大阪芸術祭奨励賞受賞。
sen.e: He received the Theatrical Performance Award of Mainichi Newspapers, and the Art Encouragement Prize from Osaka prefecture in 1959.
He received the Theatrical Performance Award of Mainichi Newspapers, and the Art Encouragement Prize from Osaka prefecture in 1959.
He received the Theatrical Performance Award of Mainichi Newspapers, and the Art Encouragement Prize from Osaka prefecture in 1959.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）芸術祭奨励賞を受章。
sen.e: He received the Art Festival Encouragement Prize in 1963.
He received the Art Festival Encouragement Prize in 1963.
He received the Art Festival Encouragement Prize in 1963.

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）4月『野崎村』お光・『助六由縁江戸櫻』揚巻で、七代目中村芝翫襲名。
sen.e: He adopted the name of Shikan NAKAMURA (VII) in the play of Omitsu in "Nozaki-mura Village" and Agemaki in "Sukeroku Yukari no Edo Zakura" (Sukeroku in Edo during cherry blossom) in 1967.
He adopted the name of Shikan NAKAMURA (VII) in the play of Omitsu in "Nozaki-mura Village" and Agemaki in "Sukeroku Yukari no Edo Zakura" (Sukeroku in Edo during cherry blossom) in 1967.
He adopted the name of Shikan NAKAMURA (VII) in the play of Omitsu in "Nozaki-mura Village" and Agemaki in "Sukeroku Yukari no Edo Zakura" (Sukeroku in Edo during cherry blossom) in 1967.

sen.j: 以降は数々の受章を受け、中村歌右衛門 (6代目)、尾上梅幸 (7代目)に次ぐ女形として活躍。
sen.e: As Shikan NAKAMURA he received many awards, and after Utaemon NAKAMURA VI and Baiko ONOE VII he was recognized as the third best female impersonator.
As Shikan NAKAMURA he received many awards, and after Utaemon NAKAMURA VI and Baiko ONOE VII he was recognized as the third best female impersonator.
As Shikan NAKAMURA he received many awards, and after Utaemon NAKAMURA VI and Baiko ONOE VII he was recognized as the third best female impersonator.

sen.j: 両優の没後は、中村雀右衛門 (4代目)、坂田藤十郎 (4代目)とともに歌舞伎界の女形の大御所として多くの舞台に出ている。
sen.e: After their deaths he performed in various Kabuki plays together with Jakuemon NANAMURA IV and Tojuro SAKATA IV as a mogul female impersonator.
After their deaths he performed in various Kabuki plays together with Jakuemon NANAMURA IV and Tojuro SAKATA IV as a mogul female impersonator.
After their deaths he performed in various Kabuki plays together with Jakuemon NANAMURA IV and Tojuro SAKATA IV as a mogul female impersonator.

sen.j: 面長の顎のしゃくれた古風な容貌で気品のある芸風。
sen.e: He has an elegant look, with a long face and upturned chin, and he performs in a characteristically graceful style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He has an elegant look, with a long face and upturned chin, and he performs in a characteristically graceful style.
He has an elegant look, with a long face and upturned chin, and he performs in a characteristically graceful style.

sen.j: 『京鹿子娘道成寺』の白拍子花子、『本朝廿四孝・十種香』の濡衣・八重垣姫、『一條大蔵譚』の常盤御前、『鎌倉三代記・絹川村閑居』の時姫、『祇園祭礼信仰記・金閣寺』の雪姫、『刺青奇遇』のお仲、『一本刀土俵入』のお蔦などが評価が高い。
sen.e: He is highly rated in the plays of Shirabyoshi dancer, Hanako in "Kyoganoko Musume Dojoji" (Maiden at Dojo-ji Temple), Nureginu and Princess Yaegaki in "Jusshuko, Honcho Nijushi Ko" (Incense Burning, from 24 Episodes of Great Children in the Country), Tokiwa Gozen in "Ichijo Okura Monogatari" (The Mad Aristocrat), Princess Toki in "Kamakura Sandaiki, Kinugawa-mura Kankyo" (Living in seclusion in Kinugawa Village, Three Generations of the Kamakura Shogunate), Princess Yuki in "Gion Sairei Shinkoki, Kinkakuji" (Kinkaku-ji Temple, Gion Honoring Story), Princess Yuki of "Gion Sairei Shinkoki" (Kinkaku-ji Temple, The Gion Festival Chronicle of Faith), Onaka in "Irezumi Chohan" (Tattooed Hantaro) and Otsuta in "Ippongatana Dohyoiri" (Into the Sumo Ring with a Sword).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is highly rated in the plays of Shirabyoshi dancer, Hanako in "Kyoganoko Musume Dojoji" (Maiden at Dojo-ji Temple), Nureginu and Princess Yaegaki in "Jusshuko, Honcho Nijushi Ko" (Incense Burning, from 24 Episodes of Great Children in the Country), Tokiwa Gozen in "Ichijo Okura Monogatari" (The Mad Aristocrat), Princess Toki in "Kamakura Sandaiki, Kinugawa-mura Kankyo" (Living in seclusion in Kinugawa Village, Three Generations of the Kamakura Shogunate), Princess Yuki of "Gion Sairei Shinkoki" (Kinkaku-ji Temple, The Gion Festival Chronicle of Faith), Onaka in "Irezumi Chohan" (Tattooed Hantaro) and Otsuta in "Ippongatana Dohyoiri" (Into the Sumo Ring with a Sword).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処OK金閣寺の雪姫、重複しているので一つ削除
sen.e: He is highly rated in the plays of Shirabyoshi dancer, Hanako in "Kyoganoko Musume Dojoji" (Maiden at Dojo-ji Temple), Nureginu and Princess Yaegaki in "Jusshuko, Honcho Nijushi Ko" (Incense Burning, from 24 Episodes of Great Children in the Country), Tokiwa Gozen in "Ichijo Okura Monogatari" (The Mad Aristocrat), Princess Toki in "Kamakura Sandaiki, Kinugawa-mura Kankyo" (Living in seclusion in Kinugawa Village, Three Generations of the Kamakura Shogunate), Princess Yuki of "Gion Sairei Shinkoki" (Kinkaku-ji Temple, The Gion Festival Chronicle of Faith), Onaka in "Irezumi Chohan" (Tattooed Hantaro) and Otsuta in "Ippongatana Dohyoiri" (Into the Sumo Ring with a Sword).

sen.j: また立役もよくし『勧進帳』の源義経・『一谷嫩軍記・敦盛』の平敦盛などが当り役。
sen.e: He is also skilled at Tachiyaku (a leading male role) and his most successful characters are MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in "Kanjincho" (List of Contributors) and TAIRA no Atsumori in "Ichinotani Futabagunki, Atsumori" (Atsumori, Chronicle of the Battle of Ichinotani).

He is also skilled at Tachiyaku (a leading male role) and his most successful characters are MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in "Kanjincho" (List of Contributors) and TAIRA no Atsumori in "Ichinotani Futabagunki, Atsumori" (Atsumori, Chronicle of the Battle of Ichinotani).

He is also skilled at Tachiyaku (a leading male role) and his most successful characters are MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune in "Kanjincho" (List of Contributors) and TAIRA no Atsumori in "Ichinotani Futabagunki, Atsumori" (Atsumori, Chronicle of the Battle of Ichinotani).

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年） 紫綬褒章、日本芸術院会員
sen.e: 1989: honored with Shijuhosho, and as a member of the Japan Art Academy
1989: honored with Shijuhosho, and as a member of the Japan Art Academy
1989: honored with Shijuhosho, and as a member of the Japan Art Academy

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年） 眞山青果大賞
sen.e: 1993: awarded the grand prize in the Seika MAYAMA awards
1993: awarded the grand prize in the Seika MAYAMA awards
1993: awarded the grand prize in the Seika MAYAMA awards

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年） 重要無形文化財保持者
sen.e: 1996: designated as a holder of the title 'Important Intangible Cultural Property'
1996: designated as a holder of the title 'Important Intangible Cultural Property'

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年） 文化功労者
sen.e: 2006: designated as a cultural contributor
2006: designated as a cultural contributor

sen.j: 逸話
sen.e: Episode
Episode
Episode

sen.j: 大向こうの掛け声は屋号の「成駒屋」のほかに、自宅が東京都港区神谷町にあることから「神谷町」とかかることもある。
sen.e: From Omuko (originally it meant the furthest seat from the stage) the audience call out his family's theatrical name, 'Narikoma-ya', or sometimes 'Kamiya-cho' as his house is located in Kamiya-cho Town, Minato Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.

From Omuko (originally it meant the furthest seat from the stage) the audience call out his family's theatrical name, 'Narikoma-ya', or sometimes 'Kamiya-cho' as his house is located in Kamiya-cho Town, Minato Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.

From Omuko (originally it meant the furthest seat from the stage) the audience call out his family's theatrical name, 'Narikoma-ya', or sometimes 'Kamiya-cho' as his house is located in Kamiya-cho Town, Minato Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 家族にも恵まれた。
sen.e: He was blessed with a large family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was blessed with a large family.
He was blessed with a large family.

sen.j: 長男に中村福助 (9代目)、次男に中村橋之助 (3代目)がおり、次女・好江の夫が中村勘三郎 (18代目)である。
sen.e: His eldest son is Fukusuke NAKAMURA IX, his second son is Hashinosuke NAKAMURA III, and Kanzaburo NAKAMURA XVIII is married to his second daughter, Yoshie.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His eldest son is Fukusuke NAKAMURA IX, his second son is Hashinosuke NAKAMURA III, and Kanzaburo NAKAMURA XVIII is married to his second daughter, Yoshie.
His eldest son is Fukusuke NAKAMURA IX, his second son is Hashinosuke NAKAMURA III, and Kanzaburo NAKAMURA XVIII is married to his second daughter, Yoshie.

sen.j: また、長女・光江は家の芸である舞踊・中村流の芸を継いでいる。
sen.e: Nakamura-ryu school, the style of dance of his family, was passed down to his eldest daughter Mitsue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nakamura-ryu school, the style of dance of his family, was passed down to his eldest daughter Mitsue.
Nakamura-ryu school, the style of dance of his family, was passed down to his eldest daughter Mitsue.

sen.j: 舞踊家として雀成会の舞台などで活躍している。
sen.e: She performs dance on the stages of the Jakusei-kai group amongst others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She performs dance on the stages of the Jakusei-kai group amongst others.
She performs dance on the stages of the Jakusei-kai group amongst others.

sen.j: 趣味は競馬。
sen.e: His hobby is horse racing
His hobby is horse racing
His hobby is horse racing

sen.j: 歌舞伎雑誌『演劇界 (雑誌)』2007年1月号でのインタビューでは、自らの競馬歴は長く、幼少時に父・五代目福助に連れられて根岸競馬場に行ったのが最初だと語った。
sen.e: In an interview in the January 2007 issue of Kabuki magazine "Engeki-kai" he explained that he had been visiting race tracks for a long time and that his first experience was at Negishi racetrack when he was taken there by his father, Fukusuke V, as a child.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In an interview in the January 2007 issue of Kabuki magazine "Engeki-kai" he explained that he had been visiting race tracks for a long time and that his first experience was at Negishi racetrack when he was taken there by his father, Fukusuke V, as a child.

In an interview in the January 2007 issue of Kabuki magazine "Engeki-kai" he explained that he had been visiting race tracks for a long time and that his first experience was at Negishi racetrack when he was taken there by his father, Fukusuke V, as a child.

sen.j: 特に印象に残ったレースはトキノミノルの東京優駿制覇（1951年）だったと語っている。
sen.e: He also mentioned that one of his most memorable races was the 1951 Tokyo Great Horses race ("Tokyo Yushun" in Japanese), won by Tokinominoru.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
